results.title: News reports from France. [No. 71/60] = Chroniques de France
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. “L’Apocalypse der Jean” - Joseph Foret of Paris puts together a huge tome on St John’s writing illustrated by seven artists and a calligrapher. 2. “Rimbaud et Charleville” - life of Rimbaud the great French poet.

results.title: News reports from France. [No. 70?/16] = Chroniques de France
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items: 1. A century of the restoration of historical monuments - about Prosper Merimee who, as Inspector General of French Historical Monuments began the work of restoring France’s historical buildings and monuments. 2. The audiovisual era - a science fair showing new audiovisual techniques and machines such as a multiple choice machine for exams and one for teaching dentistry. 3. Trade Unionism in France - shows the history of trade unionism in France and the cooperation between unions, management and the government. Shows how it works in the Renault factory.

results.title: News reports from France. [No. 70/59] = Chroniques de France
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: 1. La Rochelle - La Rochelle, 70,000 inhabitants, trade and fishing port, tourist resort, on the Atlantic coast. 2. Claude Nougaro - Annecy, one spring evening…a halt in Claude Nougaro’s singing tour. 3. France and the horse - In our mechanical universe, the horse brings us back to nature. 4. The charm of the Palais Royal - In the heart of Paris, between the Opera and the Louvre, an oasis of peace and haven of silence, the garden of the Palais Royal.

results.title: News reports from France. [No. 60/56] = Chroniques de France
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items: 1. Aix-En-Provence - Takes us through the history of the picturesque town which is a bastion of European culture. 2. Christine Caron - The story of champion swimmer who becomes a singer and movie performer. 3. Le Sologne du Grand Meaulnes - Background to the writing of a famous French novel about adolescent love. 4. Cesar - A French sculptor who went from sculpting marble to working with junkyard metal scraps.

results.title: News from nowhere
results.creator_credit: Alister Hallum and Alister Hallum Productions
results.brief_description: Describes the life and works of the English poet, artist, printer and socialist, William Morris. Cast includes: Timothy West, Kika Markham, John Cater and Clive Swift.

results.title: News digest [No. 8]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Silent players at Benalla - headquarters of the Gliding Club of Victoria; antique pistols are shown by collectors of arms; a bullock team at work hauling timber at Yellingbo; an old Chinese market gardener on his daily round; and a student riding the monocycle he made.

results.title: News digest [No. 7]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Melbourne police patrol use bicycles at night to help prevent thefts; champion highland dancer demonstrates the Highland fling and sward dance as he teaches his pupils; the history of flight from Leonardo da Vinci to space travel; water skiers ingenuity at Quandong.

results.title: News digest [No. 6]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Champion wood chopper Jack O’Toole in action; attraction of Lake Eppalock for picnics, boating, water sports and trout fishing for all water sport enthusiasts; exhibition of historic locomotives; bumper wheat crop at Werrimul; newly discovered scallop beds in Port Phillip Bay.

results.title: News digest [No. 4]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items include: “Parade of Champions” - Stockwell Stud, Diggers Rest annual open day to raise funds for Royal Children’s hospital with stallions parading at a racing stud, show the finer points of horse breeding. “Boatmen” - waterfront activities by dockworkers at the Melbourne Ports, retrieving lines from berthing ships do hazardous work. “Man of Metal” - Montsalvat, Eltham, sculptor using scrap-metal for works (Mackam Skipper) with his sister together design and execute metal screens for the National University. “Jungle Gym” - Bayswater Rotary Club provides elephant-like playground equipment.

results.title: News digest [No. 3]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Mechanized hiking in East Gippsland with a four-wheel drive vehicle which “swims” and makes its own road; infested trees are destroyed in the fight against the sirex wasp; business principles are taught and put into practice at Port Albert where children make and sell pottery; divers test their reactions and equipment under ice.
